title: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah put on individual training regime ahead of clash with Manchester United
text:
Liverpool have reportedly put Mohamed Salah on an individual training regime as they look to speed up his fitness ahead of the Premier League clash with Manchester United.

Liverpool travel to Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon hoping to maintain their perfect start to the season, winning their first eight matches - already sitting eight points ahead of Manchester City.

Salah suffered an ankle injury late on in the last-gasp 2-1 victory against Leicester last time out following a crunch challenge from Hamza Choudhury at Anfield.

Liverpool are hoping to have Mohamed Salah fully fit for their trip to Manchester United

Salah sustained an ankle injury late on against Leicester last time out in the Premier League

But according to the Mirror, the Reds have put the Egyptian through special training sessions to ensure he is fit for the short trip to Manchester on the weekend.

The 27-year-old forward limped off the pitch against Leicester but managed to avoid a serious injury and is expected to feature against Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side.

Joel Matip and Alisson are also both in line to play for the Premier League pace-setters.

Matip has resumed training after shaking off a knock last month against Sheffield United and is likely to take his place alongside Virgil van Dijk in the heart of defence.

Alisson trained with the rest of Liverpool's goalkeepers on Tuesday and will hope to play his first game since sustaining a calf muscle injury in their Premier League opener against Norwich City in August.
